name: #7 of 7 - Ku Klux Klan March Series – Austin, Texas November 1965
description: This series consists of original slides taken during the KKK march to the State Capitol in Austin, Texas on November 7th, 1965. During this era of civil unrest and anti-war protests in Austin, the Ku Klux Klan received permission to march in a pro-Vietnam war demonstration. They were received by a largely peaceful but quite vocal opposing group of citizens and students during this moment in history. This photo shows a close-up look at one of the members of the "green shirts", the Klan security team, during the march. Taken with a Praktica FX2 camera on 35mm Kodachrome film.
